text:
Just sharing interesting stats we hit 129 users of the extension and climbing more rapidly each day. 
<https://spin.d.pr/toMRGG+>
Most popular language used by users unsurprisingly is English, followed by UK English :stuck_out_tongue: because y’know it’s so different. next is Spanish.
<https://spin.d.pr/8Vls6Z+>

Thanks to one of the HubSpot German Support tech’s who responded to my post in the German forum - German translations will be arriving in v1.04

If you speak German and are interested in helping test the next version of the extension, let us know here, and we’ll shoot you a link to the beta.  As an FYI the extension uses your OS’s current language setting for translations.
The selected boolean in the condition area could be more hight contrast:
Pretty awesome! A bunch of HubSpotters use this now, especially with the introduction of the Developer Menu :raised_hands:
thank you for the feedback I’ll put up an issue on the github
What if these guys had a little button to copy their snippets without having to open the dropdown menu?

It would also be sweet if instead of the snippet giving you ```{% inline_text field="testimonial_slider_quote" value="{{ module.testimonial_slider_quote }}" %}``` you would just get ```{{ module.testimonial_slider_quote }}```

I do agree this could be a handy feature - there may be a technical challenge in implementing this unfortunately - I’m not sure offhand the data we’d need to make it work is accessible in the page before you click. Worth investigating.

this part I personally wouldn’t encourage though I get the desire.

The other part of the code is actually important, if you remove it, you actually strip out support for a future HubSpot feature. There are times when you do need to pull the value out such as when using a field  value in an html attribute. But for something that renders into the page I don’t advise it.
It removes the visual editing right? I’ve been hesitant to use the entire tag because of having to go into the source to see what it’s wrapping around the value.
